item.title: Batch file rename with PowerShell and Regular Expressions
item.description: There have been a few times in the past where I’ve had to rename a large number of files for various reasons (ie: remove a common piece of text from the name) and I’ve always defaulted to PowerShell. Piping dir into a where and matching the files I wanted to rename was effective but tedious.
